p.s: Description of Methylosinus trichosporium sp. nov.
Methylosinus trichosporium (tri.cho.spo'ri.um. G. n. trix, hair; L. n. spora, spore; N. L. n. trichosporium, hairlike spore)
The characteristics are the same as the characteristics given in the genus description above, including the following traits.
Cells are pear shaped (pyriform) and 0.5 to 1.5 μm wide by 2.0 to 3.0 μm long.
The budding of exospores from the nonflagellated ends of the cells make the cells appear somewhat like fat exclamation marks.
Colonies on NMS agar are opaque, have smooth surfaces, are low convex and circular with entire edges, have a butyrous consistency, and are white to buff.
Urease and phosphatase are not produced.
Selenite and triphenyltetrazolium chloride are not reduced.
Methane and methanol are the only known sole carbon and energy sources.
Other traits are shown in Table 2.
The G+C content of the DNA is 63 mol% (Ti).
The type strain is NCIMB 11131 (= OB3b = ACM 3311 = IMET 10543 = ATCC 35070).
